ATOM

The number of electrons orbiting the nucleus in a neutral atom is equal to the number of protons. The magnetic meridian is an equivalent imaginary line connecting the magnetic south and north poles and can be taken as the horizontal component of magnetic force lines along the surface of the earth.

The protons and neutrons are found in light nuclei. The nuclei of heavier atoms differ from light nuclei by having more neutrons and protons in their nuclei.

An ion is formed when an atom loses or gains a charge (electrons). Anions are formed by gaining electrons while cations are formed by losing electrons. During ion formation in chemical reaction there is no change in the number of protons and neutrons, but an ion is formed when the number of protons is not equal to the number of electrons
